citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The facility representative did not have a completed, written Program of Veterinary Care available at the time of
inspection. The zoo director stated that the document was currently with the attending veterinarian but was not yet
finished and returned. A written program of veterinary care is required to ensure that there is an expectation about the
care provided to all animals. Failure to establish and maintain a written program of veterinary care can decrease the
ability to ensure optimal care of the animals. A written program of care must be established and maintained so that the
licensee has a plan for providing adequate preventative care and treatments when needed, including emergency,
weekend and holiday care.
TO BE CORRECTED BY MARCH 12, 2025

There are three bags of expired monkey biscuits, intended for consumption by six adult lemurs and three black handed
spider monkeys, intermingled with non-expired bags of feed.
Expired food can have decreased nutritive value and palatability, which can be detrimental to the health of the animals
that consume it. The licensee must ensure that all food is wholesome, palatable and free from contamination and of
sufficient quantity and nutritive value to maintain all animals in good health.
TO BE CORRECTED BY MARCH 6, 2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.40(a)(1) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
The facility representative did not have a completed, written Program of Veterinary Care available at the time of 
inspection. The zoo director stated that the document was currently with the attending veterinarian but was not yet 
finished and returned. A written program of veterinary care is required to ensure that there is an expectation about the 
care provided to all animals. Failure to establish and maintain a written program of veterinary care can decrease the 
ability to ensure optimal care of the animals. A written program of care must be established and maintained so that the 
licensee has a plan for providing adequate preventative care and treatments when needed, including emergency, 
weekend and holiday care. 
TO BE CORRECTED BY MARCH 12, 2025 
3.82(a) 
   
Feeding. 
There are three bags of expired monkey biscuits, intended for consumption by six adult lemurs and three black handed 
spider monkeys, intermingled with non-expired bags of feed.  
Expired food can have decreased nutritive value and palatability, which can be detrimental to the health of the animals 
that consume it. The licensee must ensure that all food is wholesome, palatable and free from contamination and of 
sufficient quantity and nutritive value to maintain all animals in good health.  
TO BE CORRECTED BY MARCH 6, 2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
